articles.title: Wrexham's story 'written in the stars, literally'
articles.summary: Wrexham's remarkable rise continues as they knock Premier League side Nottingham Forest out of the FA Cup in dramatic fashion.

articles.title: Top four or FA Cup? - Rogers on his Villa ambitions
articles.summary: Morgan Rogers shares what the FA Cup means to him and whether he would rather win the competition or finish in the Premier League top four with Aston Villa.

articles.title: Watch every penalty from Wrexham's FA Cup win over Forest
articles.summary: Watch every penalty as Wrexham knocked out Premier League Nottingham Forest after a 3-3 draw in the third round of the FA Cup.

articles.title: 'What a finish!' | Sciver-Brunt's final over goes for 20 as RCB win last-ball thriller!
articles.summary: RCB were victorious in an epic opening match of the Women's Premier League, after Nat Sciver Brunt's final over was smashed for 20 runs.

articles.title: Wrexham shock Forest in shootout after six-goal thriller
articles.summary: Watch highlights as Wrexham shock Nottingham Forest in an FA Cup third-round thriller, beating the Premier League side on penalties after a 3-3 draw.

articles.title: Macclesfield's 'massive occasion' tinged with sadness
articles.summary: Non-league Macclesfield host holders Crystal Palace in the FA Cup on Saturday, 25 days after the death of their player Ethan McLeod.

articles.title: Chukwuemeka secures stoppage-time point for Dortmund against Frankfurt
articles.summary: Carney Chukwuemeka scores the second of two stoppage-time goals to bring Borussia Dortmund level with Eintracht Frankfurt, in a thrilling six-goal Bundesliga game.

articles.title: Shipley goal helps Port Vale past Fleetwood
articles.summary: Jordan Shipley scores the only goal to put Port Vale into the fourth round of the FA Cup at the expense of Fleetwood Town.

articles.title: New players, new managers - what to look out for in WSL after winter break
articles.summary: BBC Sport looks at the key talking points as the Women's Super League returns after a four-week winter break.

articles.title: Watch Saka's best Premier League goals
articles.summary: Watch a selection of Bukayo Saka's best Premier League goals, as the winger agrees a new contract with Arsenal.

articles.title: Macclesfield's turbulent, triumphant journey
articles.summary: Sarah Mulkerrins tells the tale of Macclesfield FC, a club that reformed in 2020 after Macclesfield Town were wound up in the High Court.

articles.title: Spurs captain Romero given additional ban after red card
articles.summary: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero is given an additional one-match suspension and fined £50,000 for his behaviour during his side's Premier League defeat to Liverpool last month.

articles.title: 'If you're outside the top six, you can never target an FA Cup run'
articles.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why the FA Cup has fallen down the pecking order for managers, despite still being a special competition.

articles.title: Rosenior will ignore 'noise' after Chelsea appointment
articles.summary: Liam Rosenior says he will be his own man and ignore the "noise" around his appointment as Chelsea manager.

articles.title: Chelsea charged after bottle thrown following Villa loss
articles.summary: The Football Association (FA) charges Chelsea after a bottle is thrown towards Aston Villa's bench in December.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Leeds forward McDonell to move to NRL at end of 2026 season
articles.summary: Leeds Rhinos forward James McDonnell will leave the club at the end of the 2026 Super League season and move to the NRL, joining current team-mate Harry Newman in the southern hemisphere.

articles.title: Henderson's stunning double as Ross County beat Thistle
articles.summary: Jay Henderson scores within 18 seconds and adds a second within 10 minutes as bottom side Ross County mark Stuart Kettlewell's return as manager with a victory over second-top Partick Thistle in the S...

highlights.title: Championship highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Wigan survive late scare to beat Preston in Lancashire derby
articles.summary: Harrison Bettoni's lone goal seals a narrow victory for League One side Wigan Athletic, as Brad Potts' injury time equaliser for Preston North End is ruled out for offside.
